alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clay; Cloud; Marshall; Nemaha; Ottawa; Republic; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Riley, Ottawa, northern Nemaha, southeastern Republic, northwestern Brown, Clay, Washington, Cloud and Marshall Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1229 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles east of Summerfield to 4 miles north of Clifton to near Ada. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concordia, Clay Center, Marysville, Sabetha, Minneapolis, Seneca, Washington, Blue Rapids, Frankfort, Clyde, Hanover, Waterville, Clifton, Miltonvale, Glasco, Linn, Axtell, Delphos, Greenleaf and Beattie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Clay; Cloud; Marshall; Nemaha; Ottawa; Republic; Riley; Washington
